DEMYSTIFY.Definition: make clear and easy to understand

QUINTESSENTIALLY.Definition: in a way that the example given is the most perfect and typical

SWUNG.Definition: brought down something with a fast movement in order to hit something

BAT.Definition: a specially shaped piece of wood used for hitting the ball in some sports

TROPHY.Definition: a prize that is given to the winner of a competition

ASH.Definition: the soft grey powder that is left as remains of burnt wood

FANS.Definition: people who enjoy watching and support a sport

GAMBLING.Definition: playing games of chance in order to earn money

PARLIAMENT.Definition: the group of politicians who make the laws of a country

LIMITING.Definition: setting a point beyond which something may not pass

BET.Definition: risk money on the result of a sports game

WAGE.Definition: a particular amount of money that is paid to an employee

INDICATION.Definition: a piece of information that shows something

AMATEUR.Definition: a person who takes part in an activity for pleasure, not professionally

AMATEURS.Definition: people  who take part in an activity for pleasure, not professionally

NOBLE.Definition: belonging to the high rich social class

RECRUIT.Definition: accept someone as a member of a team

EXPENSES.Definition: the costs required as part of the position

COLONISED.Definition: had sent people to stay in and had political control of

DIPLOMATS.Definition: officials working as representatives of their country in another country

OVERLAP.Definition: exchange (meaning that the top cricket team positions are shared among them)

COLONIES.Definition: countries that are controlled by another one

IDOL.Definition: an admired and very respected person

OUTLINE.Definition: the main information, without any details

PITCH.Definition: an area painted with lines used for playing sports

FIELDING.Definition: the attempt to catch the ball and return it in the game of cricket

BATTING.Definition: the action of hitting the ball in the game of cricket

REMAINING.Definition: the rest who are not yet used

BATSMAN.Definition: the player who uses the 'bat' in the game of cricket

PATIENCE.Definition: the ability to wait for something without complaining or being annoyed

REPUTATION.Definition: the opinion that people have about something

TRICK.Definition: deceive, try to win by not following the rules

REFEREE.Definition: a person in charge of a sports game who makes certain that the rules are followed

UNWRITTEN RULE.Definition: rules that are not written down, but are supposed to be followed anyway

CHEAT.Definition: try to win by using dishonest ways

BRIBERY.Definition: an attempt to make someone do something for you by giving them money

MATCH-FIXING.Definition: a dishonest activity to make sure that one team wins

TEMPTATION.Definition: the wish to do something that you know you should not

BANS.Definition: official prohibitions to take part in the games

SANDPAPER.Definition: strong kind of paper with an uneven and not smooth surface

TEXTURE.Definition: the feel or appearance of a surface

UNPREDICTABLE.Definition: likely to change suddenly and without reason

PUT THEM OFF.Definition: distract them, make them not pay attention

TEND.Definition: is likely to behave in a certain way

WITTY.Definition: using words in a clever and funny way

SPORTSMANSHIP.Definition: fair and respectful behaviour in sports

TRACES.Definition: things that show the existence of something

TIMELESS.Definition: not changing as the years pass

ESSENCE.Definition: the basic and most important quality

LINGUISTIC.Definition: related to the study of language

UNFAIR.Definition: not treating people in an equal and just way
